page.title: 08FARM ANIMALS
page.content: Other animals kept are beef cattle, the breeds being Hereford, Charolais, Limousin, Simmenthal and the newest, Belgium Blue. They are grown till they weigh 350 kg. at about 12 months old. Sheep produce on average 1.75 lambs a year. Pigs produce 2 litters a year averaging 10 piglets and reared to porker at 16 weeks and weigh 52 kg. Most common breed is Londrace & Large White. Poultry is kept mainly for eggs. Some are bred for broiler chickens and reared to 2 kg. A chicken farm rears 450,000 birds per year, and sells them live to Thornhills Country Produce, Bakewell.
